content: Hey all, is anyone interested in a reading group on categorical probability papers? I've heard some interest already from @Marius Furter and @Matt Cuffaro (he/him) and the like. I think a few of us have read a bit of the seminal stuff, but would like to take it to the next level.

I think my personal goals are to really build up my language so I can have some stronger dialogue with the Innsbruck, Oxford, and Nijmegen groups. And if beginners would like to join, I would gladly explain everything I know so far! And obviously if people from the above groups would wanna help us with direction, it would be kindly appreciated :sweat_smile:
Hi! There was a discussion a while ago about introductory material here.

Thanks for that Paolo! Maybe I should start another thread for intermediate reading suggestions? I think Marius and Matt and I have already read a fair bit, or have even done some of our own work/collaborated with people, but want to get really comfortable with some of the more involved examples and concepts.
